title: Race conditions with `http.batch` after latest goja update
body:
### Brief summary

There is now a race with the latest goja update and the templated runtime. 

```
==================
WARNING: DATA RACE
Read at 0x00c000baa1e0 by goroutine 2721:
  github.com/dop251/goja.(*Runtime).getArrayBufferPrototype()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/vendor/github.com/dop251/goja/builtin_typedarrays.go:1763 +0x44
  github.com/dop251/goja.(*Runtime).NewArrayBuffer()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/vendor/github.com/dop251/goja/typedarrays.go:120 +0x44
  go.k6.io/k6/js/modules/k6/http.(*Client).processResponse()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/js/modules/k6/http/request.go:128 +0xfb
  go.k6.io/k6/js/modules/k6/http.(*Client).processResponse-fm()
      <autogenerated>:1 +0x4d
  go.k6.io/k6/lib/netext/httpext.MakeBatchRequests.func1()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/lib/netext/httpext/batch.go:48 +0x21b
  go.k6.io/k6/lib/netext/httpext.MakeBatchRequests.func2()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/lib/netext/httpext/batch.go:62 +0x8a

Previous write at 0x00c000baa1e0 by goroutine 2713:
  github.com/dop251/goja.(*Runtime).getArrayBufferPrototype()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/vendor/github.com/dop251/goja/builtin_typedarrays.go:1766 +0xee
  github.com/dop251/goja.(*Runtime).NewArrayBuffer()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/vendor/github.com/dop251/goja/typedarrays.go:120 +0x44
  go.k6.io/k6/js/modules/k6/http.(*Client).processResponse()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/js/modules/k6/http/request.go:128 +0xfb
  go.k6.io/k6/js/modules/k6/http.(*Client).processResponse-fm()
      <autogenerated>:1 +0x4d
  go.k6.io/k6/lib/netext/httpext.MakeBatchRequests.func1()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/lib/netext/httpext/batch.go:48 +0x21b
  go.k6.io/k6/lib/netext/httpext.MakeBatchRequests.func2()
      /home/runner/work/k6/k6/lib/netext/httpext/batch.go:62 +0x8a
```

Observed in test logs for https://github.com/grafana/k6/actions/runs/6249783106/job/16967224373



The problems is that http.batch call `NewArrayBuffer` in parallel which might mean two different calls race to initialize the ArrayBuffer prototype.



### k6 version

unrelease v0.46.0

### OS

alll

### Docker version and image (if applicable)

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce the problem

Have an `http.batch` call

### Expected behaviour

No race

### Actual behaviour

race
